dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: An aberrant population was found in the deeper parts of lake Naivasha.  May now be extinct in Kenya due to the introduction of Tilapia and Micropterus salmoides (Ref. 3788).  Not a seasonal killifish (Ref. 27139).

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Getahun, A. 2010. Aplocheilichthys antinorii. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: This species is known from the Rift lakes, Ethiopia.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Africa:  shore weeds and shallow parks in lake Orsedi and the Suksuk river drainage near lake Zwai, in southern Ethiopia, Lake Naivasha and inflowing streams near Nairobi, southern Kenya.

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Getahun, A. 2010. Aplocheilichthys antinorii. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Getahun, A.

Reviewer/s
Snoeks, J. & Brooks, E.

Contributor/s

Justification
Although very little is known about the biology of this species, it has been reported from six lakes within the Rift Valley and is also found in the Suksuk system. No major threats are known at the moment, and it is therefore assessed as Least Concern.
